get.description: Get evidence for an InvoiceSubmission by GUID with corresponding status

post.summary: *** NOTE: Experimental. Only to be used for sending Invoice Response documents. *** Submit a new document.
post.description: Submit a document for delivery. This endpoint will replace the /invoice_submissions endpoint, but for now should only be used to send Invoice Response doucments.
Check whether Storecove can deliver an invoice for a list of ids.

parameters.name: legal_entity_id
parameters.description: The id of the LegalEntity for which to create the PeppolIdentifier

parameters.name: legal_entity_id
parameters.description: The id of the LegalEntity this PeppolIdentifier belongs to

parameters.name: superscheme
parameters.description: The superscheme of the identifier. Should always be "iso6523-actorid-upis".

parameters.name: scheme
parameters.description: PEPPOL identifier scheme id, e.g. "DE:VAT". For a full list see <<_peppol_participant_identifier_list>>.

post.description: Create a new Administration. An Administration is an email destination for purchase invoices.

parameters.name: legal_entity_id
parameters.description: The id of the LegalEntity for which to create the Administration

parameters.name: legal_entity_id
parameters.description: The id of the LegalEntity the Administration belongs to

parameters.name: legal_entity_id
parameters.description: The id of the LegalEntity the Administration belongs to

parameters.name: legal_entity_id
parameters.description: The id of the LegalEntity the Administration belongs to

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the Administration to be updated

get.summary: Get Purchase invoice data as JSON
get.description: Get a specific PurchaseInvoice, in JSON format. Recommended way of getting a PurchaseInvoice, since it provides the data in a JSON object and the JSON format is the richest we have that supports all features a PurchaseInvoice can have.

get.summary: Get Purchase invoice data as JSON with a Base64-encoded SI-1.2 UBL string
get.description: Get a specific PurchaseInvoice. Using /json as {packaging} is recommended (in which case you can just omit it), however, this endpoint allows getting the invoice in a differently serialized format such as UBL.

parameters.name: packaging
parameters.description: How to package the purchase invoice. Use "json" or "ubl"

get.summary: Get Purchase invoice data as JSON with a Base64-encoded UBL string in the specified version
get.description: Get a specific PurchaseInvoice in a non-JSON serialized format with version.

parameters.name: packaging
parameters.description: How to package the purchase invoice. Use "ubl"

parameters.name: package_version
parameters.description: The version of the ubl package.

get.description: GET a WebhookInstance from the queue. After processing it successfully, DELETE it and GET the next one. When a 204 is received, the queue is empty and the polling process can sleep for a while.

post.description: Discover a network participant and capabilities.

id.title: Id
id.description: The Storecove assigned id for the LegalEntity.

line2.title: Address line 2
line2.description: The second address line, if applicable

tenant_id.title: Tenant Id
tenant_id.description: The id of the tenant, to be used in case of multi-tenant solutions. This property will included in webhook events.

public.title: Public
public.description: Whether or not this LegalEntity is public. Public means it will be listed in the PEPPOL directory at https://directory.peppol.eu/ which is normally what you want. If you have a good reason to not want the LegalEntity listed, provide false. This property is ignored when for country SG, where it is always true.

advertisements.title: Advertisements
advertisements.description: A list of document types to advertise. Use if this LegalEntity needs the ability to receive more than only invoice documents.

line2.title: Address line 2
line2.description: The second address line, if applicable

tenant_id.title: Tenant Id
tenant_id.description: The id of the tenant, to be used in case of multi-tenant solutions. This property will included in webhook events.

public.title: Public
public.description: Whether or not this LegalEntity is public. Public means it will be entered into the PEPPOL directory at https://directory.peppol.eu/

advertisements.title: Advertisements
advertisements.description: A list of document types to advertise. Use if this LegalEntity needs the ability to receive more than only invoice documents.

scheme.title: Type
scheme.description: The scheme of the identifier. See <<_peppol_participant_identifier_list>> for a list.

superscheme.title: Type
superscheme.description: The superscheme of the identifier. Should always be "iso6523-actorid-upis".

scheme.title: Type
scheme.description: The scheme of the identifier. See <<_peppol_participant_identifier_list>> for a list.

superscheme.title: Type
superscheme.description: The superscheme of the identifier. Should always be "iso6523-actorid-upis".

sender_email_identity_id.title: Sender email identity
sender_email_identity_id.description: The id of the SenderEmailIdentity. If not provided, the Storecove default sender will be used

legal_entity_id.title: Legal etity
legal_entity_id.description: The LegalEntity the Administration belongs to.

email.title: Email
email.description: The email address to send the received document to

packaging.title: Packaging
packaging.description: How to package the purchase invoice.

sender_email_identity_id.title: Sender email identity
sender_email_identity_id.description: The id of the SenderEmailIdentity. If not provided, the Storecove default sender will be used

email.title: Email
email.description: The email address to send the received document to

packaging.title: Packaging
packaging.description: How to package the purchase invoice.

id.title: Id
id.description: The Storecove assigned id for the Administration.

sender_email_identity_id.title: Sender email identity
sender_email_identity_id.description: The id of the SenderEmailIdentity. If not provided, the Storecove default sender will be used

legal_entity_id.title: Legal etity
legal_entity_id.description: The LegalEntity the Administration belongs to.

email.title: Email
email.description: The email address to send the received document to

packaging.title: Packaging
packaging.description: How to package the purchase invoice.

status.title: Status
status.description: The overall status for this InvoiceSubmission.

actions.title: Actions
actions.description: An array of actions taken to deliver the document.

transmission_datetime.title: Transmission DateTime
transmission_datetime.description: The DateTime of the transmission, as defined by RFC 3339, section 5.6, for example, 2017-07-21T17:32:28Z.

tax_system.title: Tax System
tax_system.description: The tax system of the invoice. Either tax_line_percentages or tax_line_amounts. The first tax system means the invoice lines contain only the tax percentages and the tax amounts are included only in the tax subtotals at the invoice level and so are only calculated at the invoice level. The tax system tax_line_amounts means that in addition to the percentage, each invoice line also contains the tax amount.

legal_entity_id.title: LegalEntity id
legal_entity_id.description: The id of the LegalEntity the invoice was received for.

external_user_id.title: External user id
external_user_id.description: Used for the embedded portal retrieval service. The external_user_id you provided when the ShopAccount was created.

external_key.title: External key
external_key.description: Used for accountants. The id you specified for the organization.

system_generated_primary_image.title: System Generated Primary Image
system_generated_primary_image.description: Whether or not the document image (PDF) was generated by Storecove. If true, it means the invoice was received without any attachments and Storecove generated one for you. If false, the invoice will contain at least one attachment, which was received from the invoice sender.

tax_system.title: Tax System
tax_system.description: The tax system of the invoice. Either tax_line_percentages or tax_line_amounts. The first tax system means the invoice lines contain only the tax percentages and the tax amounts are included only in the tax subtotals at the invoice level and so are only calculated at the invoice level. The tax system tax_line_amounts means that in addition to the percentage, each invoice line also contains the tax amount. The tax subtotals at the invoice level are calculated as the sum of the tax of the invoice lines. The distinction between the two tax systems has has implications for rounding.

legal_entity_id.title: LegalEntity id
legal_entity_id.description: The id of the LegalEntity the invoice was received for.

external_user_id.title: External user id
external_user_id.description: Used for the embedded portal retrieval service. The external_user_id you provided when the ShopAccount was created.

external_key.title: External key
external_key.description: Used for accountants. The id you specified for the organization.

system_generated_primary_image.title: System Generated Primary Image
system_generated_primary_image.description: Whether or not the document image (PDF) was generated by Storecove. If true, it means the invoice was received without any attachments and Storecove generated one for you. If false, the invoice will contain at least one attachment, which was received from the invoice sender..

document.title: Document - DEPRECTATED
document.description: DEPRECTATED. Use the new atatchments array.

issue_date.title: Issue Date
issue_date.description: The date the invoice was issued. Format "YYYY-MM-DD".

tax_point_date.title: Tax Point Date
tax_point_date.description: The date the invoice was issued for tax purposes. In most countries MUST match the issue_date. Format "YYYY-MM-DD".

due_date.title: Due Date
due_date.description: The date the invoice must be payed by. Format "YYYY-MM-DD".

document_currency_code.title: Currency
document_currency_code.description: The ISO 4217 currency for the invoice.

vat_reverse_charge.title: VAT Reverse Charge - DEPRECATED
vat_reverse_charge.description: DEPRECATED - This is now part of each invoice line.

amount_including_tax.title: Amount Including Tax
amount_including_tax.description: The total invoice amount payable, including tax. This is equal to the sum of the invoice_lines (amount_excluding_tax + tax.amount)

payable_rounding_amount.title: Payable Rounding Amount
payable_rounding_amount.description: The difference between the invoice total and the sum of the invoice lines.

payable_amount.title: Amount to Pay Including Tax
payable_amount.description: The total invoice amount payable including tax. This is equal to amount_including_tax + allowance_charge + payable_rounding_amount. This property is redundant and provided only to make invoice processing easier. You can also choose to only store this property, instead of the underlying fields.

source.title: Invoice Source
source.description: The source the invoice was received from.

sender.title: Invoice Sender
sender.description: The organzation that sent the invoice.

period_start.title: Start of Period
period_start.description: The start date of the period this invoice relates to. Format "YYYY-MM-DD".

period_end.title: End of Period
period_end.description: The end date of the period this invoice relates to. Format "YYYY-MM-DD".

buyer_reference.title: Buyer Reference
buyer_reference.description: Reference provided by the buyer. Used for routing.

billing_reference.title: Billing Reference
billing_reference.description: Reference to the previous invoice this invoice relates to.

order_reference.title: Order Reference
order_reference.description: Reference to the order. Used for matching the invoice to an order.

payment_terms_note.title: Payment Terms Note
payment_terms_note.description: A textual description of the payment terms.

payment_means_payment_id.title: Payment Means Payment Id - DEPRECATED
payment_means_payment_id.description: DEPRECATED - use the payment_id property in the payment_means_array

payment_means.title: Payment Means - DEPRECATED
payment_means.description: DEPRECATED - Use the new payment_means_array array.

iban.title: IBAN
iban.description: The IBAN to which to transfer.

id.title: Id
id.description: An id to mention in the transfer.

payment_means_array.title: Payment Means
payment_means_array.description: The different payment means that can be used to pay the invoice.

delivery.title: PurchaseInvoice Delivery
delivery.description: The details of the delivery associated with this invoice.

party.title: PurchaseInvoice Party
party.description: The party the goods/services were delivered to.

name.title: Name
name.description: The name of the deliveyr party.

location.title: Location
location.description: The location the goods/services were delivered to.

scheme_id.title: Scheme Id
scheme_id.description: The scheme id for the id of the location.

accounting.title: Accounting Details - DEPRECATED
accounting.description: DEPRECATED - The accounting details for the invoice. Will only evern contain null properties.

code.title: Code
code.description: The the code of the general ledger account.

name.title: Name
name.description: A textual description of the code.

list.title: List
list.description: The name of the list for the code, e.g. "RGS".

list_version.title: List Version
list_version.description: The version of the list for the code, e.g. "1.1".

account.title: Account Number
account.description: The account number to which to transfer.

holder.title: Account Holder
holder.description: The account holder name to which to transfer.

branch_code.title: Branch code
branch_code.description: The code identifying the bank branch. May contain a BIC/SWIFT or something appropriate for the payment method, such as "NPP" for type NppPaymentMean.

mandate.title: Mandate
mandate.description: The mandate, used only for type DirectDebitPaymentMean.

network.title: Network
network.description: The payment network. Used only for type CardPaymentType.

payment_id.title: Id
payment_id.description: The payment id to use when making the payment. The invoice sender will use this to match the received funds to the invoice.

party_name.title: Party Name
party_name.description: The party who sent the invoice.

department.title: Department
department.description: The department who sent the invoice.

billing_contact.title: Billing Contact
billing_contact.description: The billing contact for the invoice.

identifiers.title: Identifiers
identifiers.description: The array of identifiers for this sender.

first_name.title: First Name
first_name.description: The first name of the billing contact.

last_name.title: Last Name
last_name.description: The last name of the billing contact.

email.title: Email
email.description: The email of the billing contact.

reason.title: AllowanceCharge reason
reason.description: The reason for the allowance or charge.

amount.title: Allowance or Charge
amount.description: The amount of the allowance or charge.

description.title: Description
description.description: The description for the invoice line.

price_amount.title: Price Amount
price_amount.description: The price for one item, excluding VAT.

amount_excluding_vat.title: DEPRECTATED - use amount_excluding_tax Amount Excluding VAT
amount_excluding_vat.description: DEPRECTATED - use amount_excluding_tax The amount excluding VAT.

amount_excluding_tax.title: Amount Excluding Tax
amount_excluding_tax.description: The amount excluding Tax. This is equal to quantity x price_amount +  allowance_charges.

vat.title: VAT Details
vat.description: The VAT details for the invoice line.

amount.title: Amount
amount.description: The amount of VAT for the invoice line.

percentage.title: Percentage
percentage.description: The percentage of VAT for the invoice line.

country.title: Country
country.description: The ISO 3166 country of the VAT for the invoice line.

accounting.title: Accounting Details
accounting.description: The accounting details for the invoice line.

guid.title: GUID
guid.description: The GUID of the WebhookInstance. Use this to delete it.

body.title: Body
body.description: The webhook body that would have been pushed if this were a push-mode webhook.

amount.title: Amount of Tax
amount.description: The amount of tax. Mandatory if taxSystem == 'tax_line_amounts'. However, it is best to use taxSystem tax_line_percentages and provide only the percentage, not the actual amount. The amount is then provided at the invoice level, in the taxSubtotals element.

percentage.title: Percentage Tax
percentage.description: The percentage Tax. This should be a valid Tax percentage in the country at the time of the issueDate of this invoice. Mandatory if taxSystem == 'tax_line_percentages'

category.title: Tax category
category.description:
The optional category code for the tax. This is not mandatory, but highly recommended. If not provided, it will be automatically derived from the country/percentage in combination with the invoice taxPointDate (which defaults to the issueDate), but there are situations in which this fails and the category needs to be specified explicitly. In particular, there are multiple categories available for 0%. The allowed values depend on the country of the tax. ++++
  • AU/NZ:
    • standard (S)
    • zero_rated (Z - 0%)
    • exempt (E - 0%)
    • export (G - 0%)
    • outside_scope (O - 0%)
  • EU:
    • standard (S)
    • zero_rated (Z - 0%)
    • reverse_charge (AE - 0%)
    • intra_community (K - 0%)
    • exempt (E - 0%)
    • export (G - 0%)
    • outside_scope (O - 0%)
  • SG:
    • standard (SR)
    • deemed_supply (DS)
    • srca_s (SRCA-S)
    • srca_c (SRCA-C - 0%)
    • zero_rated (ZR - 0%)
    • regulation33_exempt (ES33 - 0%)
    • nonregulation33_exempt (ESN33 - 0%)
    • outside_scope (OS - 0%)
    • not_registered (NG - 0%)
  • MY:
    • sales_tax (S), also 0%
    • sales_tax_work (SW)
    • service_tax (SV), also 0%
    • service_tax_import (SVI)
    • sales_export_market (EEM)
    • sales_special_area (ESP)
    • sales_designated_area (EDA)
    • exemption_schedule_a (ESA)
    • exemption_schedule_b (ESB)
    • exemption_schedule_c_a (ESC-A)
    • exemption_schedule_c_b (ESC-B)
    • exemption_schedule_c_c (ESC-C)
    • exemption_service_tax (ESV)
++++

Attachment.title: Invoice Attachment
Attachment.description: A document attachment to the invoice.

document.title: Document Attachment
document.description: The base64 encoded version of the document attachment.

mimeType.title: Mime Type
mimeType.description: The document attachment mime type. Currently only application/pdf is allowed.

filename.title: Filename
filename.description: The name of the file attachment.

primaryImage.title: Primary Image
primaryImage.description: Whether or not this document is a visual representation of the invoice data.

InvoiceSubmissionResult.title: Invoice submission result
InvoiceSubmissionResult.description: The result of an invoice submission

guid.title: GUID
guid.description: A (V4) GUID for the invoice submission

DocumentSubmissionResult.title: Document submission result
DocumentSubmissionResult.description: The result of a document submission

guid.title: GUID
guid.description: A (V4) GUID for the document submission

PreflightInvoiceRecipientResult.title: Preflight invoice recipient result
PreflightInvoiceRecipientResult.description: The result of preflighting an invoice recipient

code.title: Result code
code.description: The result code of the preflight request

InvoiceSubmission.title: Invoice submission
InvoiceSubmission.description: The invoice you want Storecove to process, with some meta-data.

createPrimaryImage.title: Create Primary Image
createPrimaryImage.description: Whether or not to create a primary image (PDF) if one is not provided.

legalEntityId.title: The LegalEntity id
legalEntityId.description: The id of the LegalEntity this invoice should be sent for.

idempotencyGuid.title: Idempotency GUID
idempotencyGuid.description: A guid that you generated for this InvoiceSubmission to achieve idempotency. If you submit multiple documents with the same idempotencyGuid, only the first one will be processed.

invoiceRecipient.title: Invoice recipient
invoiceRecipient.description: DEPRECATED. Use the routing and accountingCustomerParty.publicIdentifiers properties.

routing.title: Routing destinations
routing.description: Specifies where the invoice is to be sent. Can be electronic identifiers or email addresses.

attachments.title: Attachments
attachments.description: An array of attachments. You may provide up to 10 attchments, but the total size must not exceed 10MB after Base64 encoding.

DocumentSubmission.title: Document submission
DocumentSubmission.description: The document you want Storecove to send, with some meta-data.

createPrimaryImage.title: Create Primary Image
createPrimaryImage.description: Whether or not to create a primary image (PDF) if one is not provided.

legalEntityId.title: LegalEntity Id
legalEntityId.description: The id of the LegalEntity this document should be sent on behalf of. Either legalEntityId or receiveGuid is mandatory.

receiveGuid.title: Receive GUID
receiveGuid.description: The GUID that was in the received_invoice webhook. Either legalEntityId or receiveGuid is mandatory.

routing.title: Routing destinations
routing.description: Specifies where the document is to be sent. Can be electronic identifiers or email addresses.

idempotencyGuid.title: Idempotency GUID
idempotencyGuid.description: A guid that you generated for this DocumentSubmission to achieve idempotency. If you submit multiple documents with the same idempotencyGuid, only the first one will be processed and any subsequent ones will trigger an HTTP 422 Unprocessable Entity response.

attachments.title: Attachments
attachments.description: An array of attachments. You may provide up to 10 attchments, but the total size must not exceed 10MB after Base64 encoding.

documentType.title: Document Type
documentType.description: The type of document to be sent.

InvoiceData.title: Invoice Data
InvoiceData.description: The invoice to send, in base64 encoded format. Provide either invoice, or invoiceData, but not both.

document.title: Document
document.description: The base64 encoded version of the document.

RawDocumentData.title: Raw Document Data
RawDocumentData.description: A document to send, in base64 encoded format.

parse.title: Parse
parse.description: *** NOTE: only parse == true is currently supported *** *** NOTE: parsing is only supported for documentType == 'invoice' *** Whether or not to parse the document. If true, the data will be extracted from the document and used to construct a new document. If false, the document will be sent as is. In this case, you must ensure the document validates without any errors against the relevant validation artifacts for that processId/documentTypeId. We automatically apply updates of the validation artificats, respecting the grace period provided by the issuer. During that period, documents that validate against either the old as well as against the new artifacts are accepted. After the grace period, your document must validate against the new artifacts. You are also responsible for making sure your receiver is able to receive the updated document.

parseStrategy.title: Parse Strategy
parseStrategy.description: How to parse the document. Only needed when parse == true.

processId.title: Process Id
processId.description: The process id of the document. Required when parse == false.

documentTypeId.title: Document Type Id
documentTypeId.description: The document type id of the document. Required when parse == false.

document.title: Document
document.description: The base64 encoded version of the document.

responseCode.title: Response Code
responseCode.description: The response code. For details see https://docs.peppol.eu/poacc/upgrade-3/codelist/UNCL4343-T111/

note.title: Note
note.description: A note to add to the invoice reponse

effectiveDate.title: Effective Date
effectiveDate.description: The date when the status became effective. Format: yyyy-mm-dd.

clarifications.title: Clarifications
clarifications.description: A list of clarifications why a received invoice was rejected (RE) or under query (UQ) and what action to take.

InvoiceResponseClarification.title: Invoice Response Clarification
InvoiceResponseClarification.description: A clarification for why a received invoice was rejected (RE) or under query (UQ) and what action to take.

clarificationCode.title: Clarification Code
clarificationCode.description: The code for the clarification. For details see https://docs.peppol.eu/poacc/upgrade-3/codelist/OPStatusReason/ and https://docs.peppol.eu/poacc/upgrade-3/codelist/OPStatusAction/

clarification.title: Clarification
clarification.description: A textual description of the clarification

Invoice.title: Invoice
Invoice.description: The invoice to send.  Provide either invoice, or invoiceData, but not both.

taxSystem.title: Tax System
taxSystem.description: The tax system used for the invoice. The system 'tax_line_percentages' is preferred, but for historic purposes 'tax_line_amounts is supported and default. Since not all invoice formats that we are required to send support 'tax_line_amounts' we will need to convert the invoice to the 'tax_line_percentags' system if we are forced to send the invoice in that tax system.

consumerTaxMode.title: Consumer Tax Mode
consumerTaxMode.description: Whether or not to process the invoice in consumer tax mode. In this mode, the VAT identifier of the sender will not be the default VAT identifier, but the one that matches with the country of the receiving consumer, if that additional VAT identifier for that country is available. These additional VAT identifiers need to be added to the sending LegalEntity by Storecove, so if you need to send invoices in this mode, please contact us.

documentCurrencyCode.description: The documentCurrencyCode is the currency for the entire invoice. We currently do not support invoices in multiple currencies. If left out, will default to EUR

invoiceNumber.title: Invoice number
invoiceNumber.description: The invoice number you assigned to the invoice. The invoiceNumber should be unique for the legalEntityId and year of the issueDate. This means invoice numbers can be reused in different years, as is customary in some countries.

taxExemptReason.description: DEPRECATED. Use Tax/category and specify this per invoice line. If you do specify this field, it will be applied to all invoice lines and it is an error to specify a Tax/category at the invoice line level. This field holds the reason no tax is present in the invoice. Note that this is an invoice level field and you cannot specify it per invoice line. This field is mandatory unless tax is present in the invoice.

accountingSupplierParty.description: The party sending the invoice. Most data for the AccountingSupplierParty is taken from the Storecove database, where your sender identity resides and has been validated. However, we provide a limited number of fields (mainly contact fields) here that you can specify on an invoice-by-invoice basis. Contact us if you want to use this feature.

accountingCustomerParty.description: The party the invoice is sent to.

note.title: Note
note.description: A note to add to the invoice

paymentTerms.title: The Payment Terms
paymentTerms.description: The payment terms of the invoice.

note.title: The Payment Terms Note
note.description: The note for the payment terms.

taxSubtotals.title: Tax Subtotals
taxSubtotals.description: An array of tax subtotals. This element is mandatory for taxSystem 'tax_line_percentages'.

accountingCost.title: Accounting Cost
accountingCost.description: The buyer's accounting cost centre for this invoice, expressed as text.

invoiceType.title: Type of invoice
invoiceType.description: Do not use. This field is available for legacy reasons only. If you want to send a regular invoice (aka UBL type '380'), make sure you have a positive invoice amount. For a credit note (aka UBL type '381'), simply provide a negative invoice amount. If you, in addition to a negative invoice amount, also specify a billingReferences, your invoice will become a corrective invoice (aka UBL type '384'). If your invoice is not sent in the UBL syntax, Storecove will provide the appropriate type for the syntax the invoice is sent in.

taxPointDate.title: Tax date
taxPointDate.description: The tax date is the date on which the supply of goods or of services was made or completed or the date on which the payment on account was made insofar as that date can be determined and differs from the date of the issue of the invoice. EU 2006-112 Article 226 Point 7. Note: For the Dutch TAX authorities the tac date should be the same as the issue date.

buyerReference.title: Buyer reference
buyerReference.description: A reference provided by the buyer used for internal routing of the document.

invoicePeriod.title: Invoice period
invoicePeriod.description: The period (or specific date) to which the invoice applies. Format: yyyy-mm-dd - yyyy-mm-dd.

orderReference.title: Order reference
orderReference.description: A reference to an order for this invoice, assigned by the buyer. Note that this often is a key field, since many receivers of invoices will use this field to automatically match the invoice to an order they placed. Many receivers refuse invoices that cannot be automatically matched, in particular government agencies. So it is highly recommended to fill this field whenever possible.

salesOrderId.title: Sales Order Id
salesOrderId.description: A reference to an order for this invoice, assigned by the seller.

billingReference.title: Billing reference
billingReference.description: A reference to a commercial invoice or corrective invoice of which the current invoice is a correction. This field is mandatory when sending invoiceType 384.

contractDocumentReference.title: Contract document reference
contractDocumentReference.description: A reference to a contract or framework agreement that this invoice relates to.

projectReference.title: Project Reference
projectReference.description: Information about the project this invoice relates to.

paymentMeansIban.title: IBAN
paymentMeansIban.description: DEPRECATED. Use paymentMeansArray. The IBAN the amount payable should be transferred to

paymentMeansBic.title: BIC
paymentMeansBic.description: DEPRECATED. Use paymentMeansArray. The BIC (Swift) of the bank where the amount payable should be transferred to

paymentMeansCode.title: Payment Means Code
paymentMeansCode.description: DEPRECATED. Use paymentMeansArray. How the invoice has been / will be paid. Use only online_payment_service (payment will be made or has been made by an online payment service), bank_card (e.g. debit card, credit card), direct_debit (the amount has been / will be taken out of the client's bank account), standing_agreement (an unspecified payment means known to both buyer and seller) or credit_transfer (the buyer will do / has done a bank transfer). The numeric codes are for legacy purposes, they should not be used.

paymentMeansArray.title: Payment Means Array
paymentMeansArray.description: An array of payment means (ways to pay the invoice).

paymentMeansPaymentId.title: Payment Id
paymentMeansPaymentId.description: The payment id that you will use to match the payment against the invoice.

amountIncludingVat.title: Amount including VAT
amountIncludingVat.description: amountIncludingVat is important because of rounding differences. In many invoices, the sum of the line item amounts excluding VAT and the VAT amounts is not equal to first summing the line items without VAT, and then applying VAT. The difference is automatically calculated and included in the electronic invoice, so the receiving accounting package can process the electronic invoice without problems.

PaymentMeans.title: PaymentMeans
PaymentMeans.description: A PaymentMeans is a way to pay the invoice.

code.title: Code
code.description:
How the invoice has been / will be paid. The code determines which type of PaymentMeans is used and which fields are mandatory. ++++
  • online_payment_service, bank_card: Provide the last four digits of the card and optionally the account holder and network.
  • standing_agreement, credit_transfer: Provide the account number and optionally the account holder and branche_code.
  • direct_debit: SEPA direct debit. Provide the account number and optionally the mandate.
  • se_bankgiro, se_plusgiro: Swedish Bankgiro or Plusgiro. Provide account number and optionally the account holder.
  • aunz_npp: New Payments Platform. Provide account number and optionally the account holder.
  • sg_giro: Singapore GIRO-system (direct debit). Do not provide any fields.
  • sg_card: Singapore CreditCard payment. Do not provide any fields.
  • sg_paynow: Singapore PayNow Corporate. Provide the UEN in the account field.
++++

branche_code.title: Branch code
branche_code.description: The bank branch code. Not required for IBAN numbers. Often referred to as Swift or Bic code.

holder.title: Account holder
holder.description: The name of the account holder.

network.title: Network
network.description: The name of the card network, e.g. VISA.

TaxSubtotal.title: Tax Subtotal
TaxSubtotal.description: The total amount of tax of this type in the invoice.

taxableAmount.title: Taxable Amount
taxableAmount.description: The amount on which the tax is levied. Required unless percentage is provided.

percentage.title: Percentage Tax
percentage.description: The tax percentage. This should be a valid tax percentage in the country at the time of the taxpointDate of this invoice. Required unless taxAmount is provided.

category.title: Tax category
category.description: The tax category. For a description see <<_openapi_tax>>

lineId.title: Invoice Line ID
lineId.description: The id for this invoice line.

description.title: Description
description.description: The description for this invoice line.

name.title: Name
name.description: A short name for this invoice line. If not provided, it will be taken from description and description will be set to an emtpy string.

orderLineReferenceLineId.title: orderLineReferenceLineId
orderLineReferenceLineId.description: A reference to the ID of the order. The order is specified as the orderReference at the invoice level. It is not possible to specify an orderReference at the invoice line level. An invoice MUST at this time be for a single order only.

invoicePeriod.title: Invoice period
invoicePeriod.description: The period (or specific date) to which the invoice line applies. Format: yyyy-mm-dd - yyyy-mm-dd.

itemPrice.title: Item price
itemPrice.description: The price per item (may be fractional)

quantity.title: Quantity
quantity.description: The number of items (may be fractional).

quantityUnitCode.title: Quantity Unit Code
quantityUnitCode.description: The unit of measure that applies to the invoiced quantity. Codes for unit of packaging from UNECE Recommendation No. 21 can be used in accordance with the descriptions in the "Intro" section of UN/ECE Recommendation 20, Revision 11 (2015): The 2 character alphanumeric code values in UNECE Recommendation 21 shall be used. To avoid duplication with existing code values in UNECE Recommendation No. 20, each code value from UNECE Recommendation 21 shall be prefixed with an X, resulting in a 3 alphanumeric code when used as a unit of measure. Note that the following additionally allowed codes are deprecated and will be converted to C62: 04, 05, 08, 16, 17, 18, 19, 26, 29, 30, 31, 32, 36, 43, 44, 45, 46, 47, 48, 53, 54, 62, 63, 64, 66, 69, 71, 72, 73, 76, 78, 84, 90, 92, 93, 94, 95, 96, 97, 98, 1A, 1B, 1C, 1D, 1E, 1F, 1G, 1H, 1J, 1K, 1L, 1M, 1X, 2V, 2W, 3E, 3G, 3H, 3I, 4A, 4B, 4E, 5C, 5F, 5G, 5H, 5I, 5K, 5P, 5Q, A1, A25, A50, A51, A52, A57, A58, A60, A61, A62, A63, A64, A65, A66, A67, A77, A78, A79, A80, A81, A82, A83, AJ, AM, AP, AR, ARE, ATT, AV, AW, B0, B2, B36, B37, B38, B39, B40, B5, B51, B6, B65, B9, BD, BE, BG, BH, BJ, BK, BL, BO, BR, BT, BW, BX, BZ, C1, C2, C4, C5, C6, C77, C98, CA, CH, CJ, CK, CL, CO, CQ, CR, CS, CT, CU, CV, CY, CZ, D14, D28, D35, D37, D38, D39, D40, D64, D66, D67, D7, D70, D71, D72, D75, D76, D79, D8, D9, D90, D92, D96, D97, D98, D99, DC, DE, DI, DQ, DR, DRM, DS, DU, DX, DY, E2, E3, E5, EC, EP, EV, F1, F9, FB, FD, FE, FG, FM, G7, GC, GD, GH, GK, GN, GRT, GT, GW, GY, GZ, H1, H2, HAR, HD, HE, HF, HI, HJ, HK, HL, HN, HO, HP, HS, HT, HY, IC, IF, II, IL, IM, IP, IT, JB, JG, JO, JR, K5, KD, KF, KG, KS, KTM, LC, LE, LI, LJ, LX, M0, MA, MF, MK, MQ, MT, MV, N2, NB, NBB, NC, ND, NE, NG, NH, NI, NJ, NN, NPL, NPR, NQ, NR, NRL, NTT, NV, NY, OP, OZ, P0, P3, P4, P6, P7, P8, P9, PA, PB, PE, PF, PG, PK, PL, PM, PN, PT, PU, PV, PW, PY, PZ, QD, QH, QK, QT, R4, RA, RD, RG, RK, RL, RN, RO, RS, RU, S5, S6, S7, S8, SA, SD, SE, SHT, SK, SL, SN, SO, SP, SS, SST, ST, SV, T1, T4, T5, T6, T7, T8, TA, TC, TD, TE, TF, TJ, TK, TL, TN, TQ, TR, TS, TSD, TSH, TT, TU, TV, TW, TY, UA, UD, UE, UF, UH, UM, VI, VQ, VS, W4, WH, WI, WR, WW, YL, YT, Z1, Z2, Z3, Z4, Z5, Z6, Z8

allowanceCharge.title: allowanceCharge
allowanceCharge.description: The discount or surcharge on this item. Should be negative for discounts

amountExcludingVat.title: amountExcludingVat
amountExcludingVat.description: The amount excluding VAT. Should equal quantity x itemPrice + allowanceCharge.

tax.title: Tax
tax.description: The tax for this invoice line. In the future, the taxes_duties_fees array will become the standard way of providing this information and you are invited to use that.

taxes_duties_fees.title: Taxes, Duties and Fees
taxes_duties_fees.description: An array of taxes, duties and fees for this invoice line. At this moment, only a single Tax item is allowed. When used, the 'tax' element must be empty.

accountingCost.title: Accounting Cost
accountingCost.description: The buyer's accounting cost centre for this invoice line, expressed as text.

delivery.title: Delivery
delivery.description: The delivery of the invoice line.

additionalItemProperties.title: Additional Item Properties
additionalItemProperties.description: An array of additional item properties.

sellersItemIdentification.title: Sellers Item Identification
sellersItemIdentification.description: The ID the seller assigned to this item.

buyersItemIdentification.title: Buyers Item Identification
buyersItemIdentification.description: The ID the buyer assigned to this item.

standardItemIdentificationSchemeId.title: Standard Item Identification Scheme
standardItemIdentificationSchemeId.description: The scheme for the standardized ID for the item.

standardItemIdentificationSchemeAgencyId.title: Standard Item Identification Scheme Agency
standardItemIdentificationSchemeAgencyId.description: The scheme agency for the standardized ID for the item.

AdditionalItemProperty.title: Additional Item Property
AdditionalItemProperty.description: An additional property for the item

amountExcludingVat.title: Amount
amountExcludingVat.description: The amount for the allowance or charge, excluding VAT

tax.title: Tax
tax.description: The tax for this allowance or charge. In the future, the taxes_duties_fees array will become the standard way of providing this information and you are invited to use that.

taxes_duties_fees.title: Taxes, Duties and Fees
taxes_duties_fees.description: An array of taxes, duties and fees for this allowance or charge. At this moment, only a single Tax item is allowed. When used, the 'tax' element must be empty.

reason.title: Reason
reason.description: The reason for the allowance or charge, free text

reasonCode.title: Reason Code
reasonCode.description: Do not use. Contact Storecove first if you want to use this field.

Party.title: Party
Party.description: A party that can receive or send invoices

companyName.title: Company name
companyName.description: The name of the company receiving the invoice

AccountingSupplierParty.title: Supplier
AccountingSupplierParty.description: The party sending the invoice. Most data for the AccountingSupplierParty is taken from the Storecove database, where your sender identity resides and has been validated. However, we provide a limited number of fields here that you can specify on an invoice-by-invoice basis.

SupplierParty.title: SupplierParty
SupplierParty.description: A party that can send invoices

accountId.title: Account id
accountId.description: The account id you assigned to the customer.

publicIdentifiers.title: Public identifiers
publicIdentifiers.description: A list of legal and tax identifiers for this customer.

Routing.title: Recipient ids
Routing.description: The different ways to send the invoice to the recipient. The publicIdentifiers are used to send via the Peppol network, if the recipient is not registered on the Peppol network, the invoice will be sent to the email addresses in the emails property. This property is only mandatory when sending the invoice data using the <<_openapi_invoice>> property, not when sending using the <<_openapi_invoicedata>> property, in which case this information will be extracted from the <<_openapi_invoicedata>> object. If you do specify an <<_openapi_invoicerecipient>> object and an <<_openapi_invoicedata>> object, the data from the two will be merged.

eIdentifiers.title: Electronic Identifiers
eIdentifiers.description: The electronic identifiers for this invoice recipient. These are the identifiers used on the Peppol network.

emails.title: Fallback email
emails.description: The email addresses the invoice should be sent to if none of the other identifiers can be used

items.title: Email
items.description: The email address the invoice should be sent to

InvoiceRecipient.title: Recipient ids
InvoiceRecipient.description: The different ways to send the invoice to the recipient. The publicIdentifiers are used to send via the Peppol network, if the recipient is not registered on the Peppol network, the invoice will be sent to the email addresses in the emails property. This property is only mandatory when sending the invoice data using the <<_openapi_invoice>> property, not when sending using the <<_openapi_invoicedata>> property, in which case this information will be extracted from the <<_openapi_invoicedata>> object. If you do specify an <<_openapi_invoicerecipient>> object and an <<_openapi_invoicedata>> object, the data from the two will be merged.

publicIdentifiers.title: Public Identifiers
publicIdentifiers.description: The public identifiers for this invoice recipient. These are the identifiers used on the Peppol network. Note that when sending invoices with VAT (or with a taxExemptReason), a receiver VAT number is required and that should be one of these publicIdentifiers.

emails.title: Fallback email
emails.description: The email addresses the invoice should be sent to if none of the other identifiers can be used

items.title: Email
items.description: The email address the invoice should be sent to

InvoiceRecipientPreflight.title: Invoice recipient preflight
InvoiceRecipientPreflight.description: Identifies the invoice recipient to preflight

publicIdentifiers.description: The public identifiers for this invoice recipient.

EIdentifiers.title: Electronic identifiers
EIdentifiers.description: A list of electronic routing identifiers. These are the identifiers used on the Peppol network or for other destinations.

scheme.title: Scheme
scheme.description: The scheme of the identifier. See <<_peppol_participant_identifier_list>> for a list.

PublicIdentifiers.title: Public identifiers
PublicIdentifiers.description: A list of public identifiers that uniquely identify this customer.

PublicIdentifier.title: Public identifier
PublicIdentifier.description: A public identifier for this customer.

scheme.title: Scheme
scheme.description: The scheme of the identifier. See <<_peppol_participant_identifier_list>> for a list.

street1.title: Street 1
street1.description: The street name and number. Mandatory in most countries.

street2.title: Street 2
street2.description: The second street field. Use this if you used the first field for the building name.

city.title: City
city.description: The name of the city. Mandatory in most countries.

zip.title: Zipcode
zip.description: The zipcode/postalzone. Mandatory unless the country does not have zip codes.

actualDate.title: Actual Date
actualDate.description: The actual date of the delivery.

schemeId.title: Identifier Scheme ID
schemeId.description: The schemeId of the location identifier (e.g. 'EAN')

schemeAgencyId.title: Identifier Scheme Agency ID
schemeAgencyId.description: The schemeAgencyId of the location identifier (e.g. 'ZZZ')

documentTypes.title: DocumentTypes
documentTypes.description: An array of document types to discover. The default is '["invoice", "creditnote"]'

network.title: Network
network.description: The network to check. Currently only 'peppol' is supported.

metaScheme.title: Meta Scheme
metaScheme.description: The meta scheme of the identifier. For Peppol this is always 'iso6523-actorid-upis'.

scheme.title: Scheme
scheme.description: The scheme of the identifier. See <<_peppol_participant_identifier_list>> for a list.

DiscoveredParticipant.title: Discovered Participant
DiscoveredParticipant.description: A public identifier for this customer.

email.title: Email
email.description: Whether or not an 'OK' response means the document will be sent via Peppol, but delivered by email. This happens in the Belgian Hermes system where all identifiers have been registered, but if the receiver hasn't registered with a service provider, the Hermes system will send a PDF created from the electronic invoice and email that. The electronic document will itself not be emailed. Also see https://einvoice.belgium.be/en/article/send-structured-invoices-all-your-customers-hermes[Hermes^].
